TIP Certification Deadline Extended for 2020 Grads

The Michigan legislature has approved an extension of the TIP certification deadline for the graduating Class of 2020. Class of 2020 graduates will now have until August 31, 2021 to certify their TIP benefits. To qualify for the extension, a student must have graduated high school after March 15, 2020 and before September 1, 2020.

If you have questions, please contact Student Scholarships, Grants and Outreach (SSGO) at 1-888-447-2687 or by email at mistudentaid@michigan.gov.

The Bessemer Chapter of the National Honor Society held its 2020 Induction Ceremony on Thursday, February 27th. Eleven new members were inducted into the Bessemer Chapter.

Historic Ironwood Theater's Operation Manager Bruce Greenhill was the guest speaker. In his speech, Greenhill touched upon the four pillars of NHS which are scholarship, service, leadership and character. Greenhill told the audience how serving not only helps the community but can be rewarding to the person who serves.

After the ceremony, those present enjoyed a light supper. A special thanks from all those present to Greenhill for sharing his wisdom and to Chris Lahti and the Elk and Hound for making the food.

Front Row: Jack Nyquist*, Julia Stomberg*, Eliza Stone, Vai Triggiano, Kayte Rand, Phoebe Napier, Jewel Jett*, Janelle Lekies*, Lainey Kulak*, Kristen Smith*
Back Row: Adviser Tracy Rowe, Kaylee Makinen*, Jack Matrella*, Adam Mazurek, Tad Rowe, Jaakob Fyle, Reiley Hollenbeck*, Teddy Wittla-Sprague*, Josh Pospeck*
*indicates new inductee

From the Negaunee Miners regarding this Friday night's game. They will be honoring current and former U.P. Miners.

On Friday night, our Negaunee Miners will host the Gogebic Miners. It is rare for two teams who share the same nickname to play against each other. What makes this game even more unique is the history behind the nickname. We have plans for special recognition to be given at Friday's contest. Not only will we be honoring Coach Dick Koski, as the two teams play for the Dick Koski Trophy, but we will also pay tribute to our current and past employees of U.P. mines. All current and former miners will be admitted to the game for free. They will also receive a flashlight, donated by Eagle Mine, as they enter the game. At halftime, a short history of mining, from both areas, will be presented by Sean O'Donnell. As Mr. O'Donnell finishes, miners will be asked to shine their flashlight in honor/memory of those who proudly hold the title of Miners.

Promoting Healthy Schools
Through the University of Michigan

A.D. Johnston High School was granted an award through the University of Michigan that is an initiative that Promotes Healthy Schools. The Wellness team includes: Mr. Nick Heikkila, wellness champion, Mrs. Jeannine Simcoe, Media and Technology, and Mr. Dan Niemi, Principal. The program is set to begin this month at the A.D. Johnston High School and was pursued by Mr. Niemi and Mr. Heikkila. It includes healthy lifestyles, eating and exercise along with health education. Mr. Brad Newman met with Mr. Heikkila and Mr. Niemi and then ‘Kicked off” the event with a picture of the Promoting Healthy Schools Banner to be hung in the school.

post_text: Big changes are coming for Box Tops for Education! You may have noticed that some of the products you buy in the store have a different Box Tops logo on them. Box Tops is moving away from the need to clip the coupons off the boxes. Instead, there is an app to download on your phone. When you download the app, there are simple directions on how to get started, and it only takes a couple of minutes. When you buy items that earn Box Top credits, you just scan your receipt within 14 days of purchase. No need to clip and count coupons! Signing up only takes a few minutes! We have earned quite a bit from the Boxtops program in the past. The money all goes to help our students. Every Box Top counts, and this change should make it easier than ever to earn money for our school. Just download the Box Tops for Education app, choose Washington Elementary (make sure it is the Bessemer, MI one), and start scanning your receipts! The app tracks how much you raise so you can see the impact you alone are having on our school!
